item.description:
Up for some behind-the-scenes movie-making insights? Head out to Wheaton College, Thursday, April 5, for a talk by Oscar-winning director/screenwriter Alexander Payne.

The evening gets under way at 7 p.m. with a screening of "Sideways," a quirky tale of two friends on a trip through California's wine country that starred Paul Giamatti, Thomas Haden Church and Virginia Madsen. The movie earned Payne an Oscar for screenwriting and a nomination as best director. He also was nominated this year for directing George Clooney's "The Descendants" and won for its screenplay.

The program is free and open to the public at the Weber Theater, Watson Fine Arts Center, Wheaton College, 26 East Main St., Norton, Mass.
item.how_to_find_us: Posted as an FYI - please RSVP if you're going so others can see who you are and look for you! If you'd like to host, please say so in your RSVP!
item.name: P-Collective FYI - "Sideways" film screening and talk by Alexander Payne!
